Belgia: 1591: March
To
[.]
It may please yo
r
H. to be advertised,
at
I receaved of late a letter from my
LL.
of
the Councell, w
t
charge to deale w
t
e
Generall
states
, about
e relaxation of a certain newe
custome, imposed by
e
states of Holland
,
upon Inglishe clothes. Also to
e same effect
e Company of
e
Marchants adventurers
have
written unto me from
Middlebourgh.
Howbeit
it is but in generall termes, w
t
out any specifi-
cation w
at
custome it is, wherew
t
they finde
themselves aggrieved: nether can I learne it
otherwise by any that are here. Wheruppon I
am forced to attend a further informac
o
n
from
e Marchants, w
ch
when I have receaved,
I will doe my uttermost diligence in folowing
their cause. Moreover this day
the
Councell of state
hath dispatched a letter
to my LL. of her
Ma
ties
Councell, in answear
to that w
ch
M
r
Wilkes
delivered by worde of
mouth to
M
r
Ortell
, concerning their late
petitions: wherein
ei complaine, that my LL.
in maters of suche moment, vouchesafes not
to yeld an answear unto them in writing.
They have also written to Ortell, wherein
they specifie those pointes of their fomer letter,
whiche they would have to be solicited, till
their LL. answear be obtened. They
can not justly complaine, as I have signified
unto them,
as
for want of an answear, con-
sidering that her Ma
tie
hath of late, and at
sundrie times, both by letters and otherwise, re-
quired an answear from
e Generall states,
to causes of as great or greater Consequence,
whether
wherto no answear hath bin made by

word or by writing. [.] there was
litle contened in their late letter, wherunto
they had not already both
by
from me, and
otherwise receaved satisfacti
o
, as I particu-
larely declared. But
tly by th
e
selves,
and
tly otherwise I might
ceave,
at
they had bin charged expressely by
e
Generall states to require
t
answear
in writing w
ch
M
r
Wilks
i
parted by
word of mouth. I c
a

o
jecture
wherto this curiositie of

tend, unles it be to have s

unto

i
ces, thereby to serve their
owne turnes, as if her Ma
tie

of observ

ch
